DataElement.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factor SEER Primary Tumor Indicator Number Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Variable used to collect information on the primary tumor so that a summary stage can be easily derived for these cases.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factor Diagnosis Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results Program Primary Neoplasm Involvement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body._The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._A cancer registry mandated under the National Cancer Act of 1971 to operate and maintain a population-based cancer reporting system, reporting periodically estimates of cancer incidence and mortality in the United States. The Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results (SEER) Program is a continuing project of the National Cancer Institute of the National Institutes of Health. Among its goals, in addition to assembling and reporting cancer statistics, are the monitoring of annual cancer incident trends and the promoting of studies designed to identify factors amenable to cancer control interventions. (From a brochure of the National Cancer Institute, NIH Publication No. 91-3074, October 1990)_A tumor at the original site of origin._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.:The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.
The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Property.preferredName: Diagnosis Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results Program Primary Neoplasm Involvement
Property.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:A cancer registry mandated under the National Cancer Act of 1971 to operate and maintain a population-based cancer reporting system, reporting periodically estimates of cancer incidence and mortality in the United States. The Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results (SEER) Program is a continuing project of the National Cancer Institute of the National Institutes of Health. Among its goals, in addition to assembling and reporting cancer statistics, are the monitoring of annual cancer incident trends and the promoting of studies designed to identify factors amenable to cancer control interventions. (From a brochure of the National Cancer Institute, NIH Publication No. 91-3074, October 1990):A tumor at the original site of origin.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.longName: Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results Program
Concepts.definition: A program of the National Cancer Institute that provides information on cancer statistics in an effort to reduce the cancer burden among the U.S. population.
A tumor at the original site of origin.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification._A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.: Knowledge on which to base belief.: A tumor at the original site of origin.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
Knowledge on which to base belief.
A tumor at the original site of origin.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Far apart in space, time, or relevance from a point of reference.

Concepts.definition: Far apart in space from a point of origin on the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or belonging to a broader area or region of the body.: Not characterized in any other way.

Concepts.definition: Of or belonging to a broader area or region of the body.
Not characterized in any other way.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or belonging to a broader area or region of the body.: The spread or migration of cancer cells through the wall of an organ into surrounding organs and/or adjacent tissues.

Concepts.definition: Of or belonging to a broader area or region of the body.
The spread or migration of cancer cells through the wall of an organ into surrounding organs and/or adjacent tissues.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Restricted to the site of origin, without evidence of spread.

Concepts.definition: Restricted to the site of origin, without evidence of spread.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: In the natural or normal place, confined to the site of origin without invasion of neighboring tissues.

Concepts.definition: In the natural or normal place, confined to the site of origin without invasion of neighboring tissues.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries
